oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A new caging phototrigger based on a 2-acetonaphthyl chromophore
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KHADE, PRASHANT K
SINGH, ANIL K
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: chromophore
carboxylic acid
nanotechnology
photolysis
esters
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Irradiation (Î» ~ 350 nm in an aqueous environment) of carboxylic acid esters derived from the reaction between carboxylic acids and 2-bromo-1-(naphthalene-2-yl)ethanone affords the parent carboxylic acid in good yield, making the 2-acetonaphthyl chromophore a good phototrigger for caging applications, including biomolecular caging.
